subject: Ethics
title: Age-Based Rationing Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to Age-Based Rationing Debate.

hook.text: A philosopher proposed denying expensive treatment to anyone over 75. He said it would be more fair.

buildup.text: Daniel Callahan argued that society should set an age limit on publicly funded life-extending treatments.

discovery.text: His logic: resources spent extending old age could save younger lives with more years ahead of them.

twist.text: But many 80-year-olds are healthier than some 50-year-olds. Age is a terrible proxy for quality of life.

climax.text: No country officially rations by ageâ€”but in practice, older patients are quietly deprioritized everywhere.

punchline.text: We ration by age already. We just don't admit it.

quiz.question: What did philosopher Daniel Callahan propose about healthcare rationing?
options: Society should set an age limit on publicly funded life-extending treatments
All healthcare should be free regardless of age
Only children should receive publicly funded healthcare
